etymology.description: 下(下) (xià, "fall") + 雪(雪) (xuě, "snow") = when snow falls
etymology.interpretation: The term 下雪 (xià xuě) literally means 'snow fall' and is used to describe the meteorological event when snow descends from the sky.

examples.chinese: 昨晚下雪了(昨晚下雪了)。
天越来越冷(天越來越冷)，下雪的日子真美(下雪的日子真美)。
examples.pinyin: Tiān yuèláiyuè lěng, xià xuě de rìzi zhēn měi
examples.english: The weather is getting colder, and snowy days are truly beautiful.

examples.chinese: 一出门就遇到下雪(一出門就遇到下雪)，心情就变得愉快(心情就變得愉快)。
examples.pinyin: Yī chūmén jiù yùdào xià xuě, xīnqíng jiù biàn dé yúkuài
examples.english: When I stepped out, it started snowing, and my mood instantly became cheerful.
